page.title: 04Skenfrith Mill
page.content: Skenfrith Mill was built before 1500 and was rebuilt in 1867. The Edwards Family has owned it for 90 years. Wholemeal flour is produced by grinding high protein milling wheat between slow moving millstones.No artificial preservatives are added to this flour. Animal feed is produced from a mixture of barley, oats and wheat. Milling is carried out on Saturdays and the flour is sold fresh from the mill as well as being transported to local towns. The machinery is driven by a water wheel which has 30 wooden paddles. The water wheel drives the pit wheel. The Wallower Wheel turns the Great Spur wheel which drives the Crown Wheel. The miller judges the quality of the flour by using his "Thumb of Gold". .
